title: Propalaeocastor
text: Propalaeocastor is a poorly known extinct <a href="genus">genus</a> of <a href="beaver">beaver</a>s (family <a href="Castoridae">Castoridae</a>) from the early <a href="Oligocene">Oligocene</a> of <a href="Europe">Europe</a> and <a href="Asia">Asia</a>. Recently described material of a new species of "Propalaeocastor", "P. irtyshensis", indicates the genus is probably the earliest known member of the subfamily Castorinae, which includes all castorids more closely related to living <a href="beaver">beaver</a>s (genus "Castor") than to the extinct <a href="Castoroides">giant beaver</a> (genus "Castoroides"). Previously, "Propalaeocastor" had been allied with more basal beavers such as "<a href="Agnotocastor">Agnotocastor</a>" and "<a href="Anchitheriomys">Anchitheriomys</a>". According to Wu and coauthors, "Propalaeocastor", specifically "P. butselensis", is the likely ancestor of the better-known <a href="Eurasia">Eurasia</a>n castorine "<a href="Steneofiber">Steneofiber</a>".
